content: round without twisting sts using k2 p2 ribbing work cuff to 4cm/1 75 or to preferred length change to plain stocking stitch and work until leg of sock is ~15cm/6 long or to preferred length setup for heel flap knit 28 30 32 34 36 38 stitches place remaining stitches on hold for instep and work heel flap as follows heel flap worked back and forth row 1 ws sl1 wyif purl to end of row row 2 rs *sl1 wyib k1 repeat from * to end of row repeat row 1 and 2 13 14 15 16 17 18 more times note you may add additional sets of row should you wish to have a taller heel flap helpful if you have a high instep keep track of additional sets of row so you can adjust the number of stitches picked up along the gusset purl the next ws row turn heel row 1 rs sl1 wyib k13 14 15 16 17 18 ssk k1 turn row 2 ws sl1 wyif p1 p2tog p1 turn row 3 sl1 wyib k to one st before gap made by decrease on previous row ssk k1 turn row 4 sl1 wyif p to one st before gap made by decrease on previous row p2tog p1 turn continue working as established until all sts have been worked omitting final st before turn on the last two row and 14 15 16 17 18 19 sts remain knit across heel sts heel gusset pick up and knit 14 15 16 17 18 19 sts along left side of heel flap pm work instep sts pm pick up and knit 14 15 16 17 18 19 sts along right side of heel flap if you made your heel flap longer add one extra st for each additional pair of row you added hint you will use the slipped sts to for your pickup and work each of these sts through either both loops of the slipped stitch or using the back loop this will twist the stitch to tighten them up you can pick up one or two additional stitches in the corner of the heel flap to prevent a hole forming place markers to indicate edges of instep stitches and work additional row of gusset shaping if you pick up additional sts © caroline sommerfeld 2024 3 vanilla st r ipy socks note for size l only when working the below instructions work rounds 1 & 2 until you have 69 sts and then work an additional decrease round decreasing on one side only to bring your stitch count to an even number gusset decreases round 1 knit to 3 sts before 1st m k2tog k1 sm k to next m sm k1 ssk k to end of round round 2 knit repeat rounds 1 and 2 until you have 56 60 64 68 72 76 stitches total or stitch count preferred for fit continue to knit in stocking stitch until foot
